name: The Best Rolled Sugar Cookies
author: J. Saunders
summary: Whenever you make these cookies for someone, be sure to bring along several copies of the recipe!  You will be asked for it, I promise! NOTE: I make icing with confectioners' sugar and milk. I make it fairly thin, as I 'paint' the icing on the cookies with a pastry brush. Thin enough to spread easily but not so thin that it just makes your cookies wet and runs off.
directions: In a large bowl, cream together butter and sugar until smooth
Stir in the  flour, baking powder, and salt
Cover, and chill dough for at least one hour (or overnight)
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Roll out dough on floured surface 1/4 to 1/2 inch thick
Cut into shapes with any cookie cutter
Place cookies 1 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheets
Bake 6 to 8 minutes in preheated oven
